intro: Corydalis paeoniifolia var. minor, commonly known as the lesser peonyleaf corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features slender, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Native to regions of Asia, it thrives in woodland and shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for rock gardens and shaded borders in horticulture.
